title: Does anyone actually like Definitely not Dominion?
body:
So basically for the second time this game mode has come up, and seriously, it is probably the worst game mode on the list, it's basically like playing a shitty SR with one lane and a jungle.

Can we please have this removed from the queue, considering this is probably the only one that gets like no play time?

replies.body: I've only played two rounds of DND so far and I think it's pretty great. Of all the maps to draw comparisons with, SR is honestly the one with the least connections. The elements which they've brought on (the center alter from Twisted Treeline, a Shard from Ascension and the centralised skirmishes of ARAM at the top point), are all built on the _running around a large circular map capturing points_ that made Dominion fun. I can't help but feel it's a massive improvement just by being mindless enough to not need any strategy, open-ended enough to allow nearly any champion and dynamic enough to compel me until the end of it.

Agreed, of course if you take it super seriously and just focus on win win win you aren't going to have any fun. The whole point of rotating gamemodes are to be a fun break, they aren't meant to be treated like ranked.

I agree with you completely, it's designed and executed as a casual map, trying to play it as anything else is gonna leave you dissatisfied. All in all I think it's actually a really fun gamemode (and any chance to earn those sweet mastery tokens is well worth it right? ;) ).

capture top tower and stand under it with a stun but

stale after 2 games, its only fun if i play something like akali
Not really. I don't like any of the casual game modes though. Same shit all the time... More stale than Summoners Rift.
its better than OFA aram and hexakill. I'd say its on par with ascension.
Me and my mates have been enjoying it, it has even seen some of the weirdest champs be strong in it (my friend started slaughtering people as Urgot{{champion:6}}).
